sections.description: I earned a master degree as part of an international program named Global Software Engineering European Master (GSEEM), distributed between Italy and Sweden. I spent the second year in Sweden where I attended 4 projects exams (with real customers) in the first semester, and the master thesis project titled 'Enhancing the consistency between requirements and test cases through the definition of a Controlled Natural Language.' in the second semester

I spent the first year of the master degree in my hometown, at the university of L'Aquila. Here I did around 10 exams both theoretical and practical, the most interesting were Software Engineering, Mobile Application Development and Model Driven Engineering.

I studied Computer Science as a bachelor degree, in the University of L'Aquila. This course gives a solid theoretical background, and a wide techology overview. I ended the studies, with a thesis work titled 'Design and development of a Java context aware mobile application'.
